alert.note: Alert for Allegheny (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 2:45PM EST until January 06 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Ohio River At Pittsburgh affecting Allegheny County.
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. PAC003-040745- /O.NEW.KPBZ.FL.Y.0001.230103T1945Z-230106T1200Z/ /PTTP1.N.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 245 PM EST Tue Jan 3 2023 ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Ohio River at Pittsburgh. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the Monongahela Parking Wharf. At 19.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the North Shore riverwalk between the stadiums. At 19.5 feet, The Monongahela Parking Wharf is completely flooded. At 20.0 feet, Water is up to one foot deep in the lower areas of the North Shore Riverwalk. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 16.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.2 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Action stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
